projectDesc.p: WorldViews is a multilingual‚ digital resource for primary sources containing excerpts from textbooks from around the world on topics that are of global‚ transnational and interregional relevance. The selected source material from textbooks reveals how the individual countries position themselves in the world and how they portray other countries and their histories. Academic contributions provide more in-depth interpretations of the source material as well as information on the national education and textbook systems and background information on the history of education.

samplingDecl.p: Text excerpts are chosen because they are striking in terms of representation interpretive framework and/or perspective. They are portrayals that are published in widely distributed textbooks or stand out due to their unique standpoint. They are collected by project partners or the editorial team‚ given academic context and translated into German and English paying particular attention to the cultural and historical context of the source text.

abstract.p: In 1976, this textbook for primary education already reached its tenth edition. It was followed by the volume Creative Teaching of Brazilian history – Empire and Republic.
This comic depicts an encounter between the colonising Portuguese and the indigenous peoples of today's Brazil.

This comic depicts an encounter between the colonising Portuguese and the indigenous people of what is now Brazil. In the first scene, a Portuguese man asks a member of the indigenous tribe if the land has any gold or gems to offer, and whether a conquest would be profitable. The indigenous man, equipped with a headdress and a spear, is bewildered.

In the second scene, two indigenous people are secretly watching a Portuguese church service. One of them expresses his lack of understanding for the way in which the new arrivals are celebrating their festivities.
